As noted in the rough surface contact section, the real area of contact is invariably dian the apparent area of contact. The most common model of friction is based on assuming that the patches of real contact area form juncüons in which the two bodies adhere to each other. The resistance to sliding, or friction, is due to these juncüons. Source: Bowden [31
